messages.message: anybody can help granting me permissions on aws to look up route53 zone so I can renew the ssl certificate for a sandbox? :pray:
Can you message IT via callonme@ and cc me.
@shiqi which sandbox is this? we generally manage SSL certs via let’s encrypt
It is heymian’s sandbox on GCP, are we still using the cert manager or it is done differently now

~either we use cert-manager or lego cli but almost every env use let’s encrypt.~

~You will still need R53 creds though but don’t create a AWS ACM cert for a sandbox.~

~do we have cert-manager installed on this cluster?~

---

Oh sorry I misread, you need R53 zone creds for let’s encrypt DNS validation
yeah all steps points to AWS creds to run those steps manually, I was told the sandboxes are configured to auto renew the cert, is that the case or maybe I misheard?

Got it.

The cluster should have cert-manager running but if it’s not there we should add it otherwise it will be task to manually renew every 60 days.
